Primitive Category H

Source: R/primitives.R
category-h.Rd

The primitive category H is defined as: - Objects: stock, flow, link - Morphisms: - u: flow → stock (upstream/source) - d: flow → stock (downstream/target) - s: link → stock/variable (source) - t: link → flow (target)

Details

A stock-flow diagram is a functor F: H → FinSet that maps: - F(stock) = set of stock IDs - F(flow) = set of flow IDs - F(link) = set of link IDs - F(u) = function mapping flows to source stocks - F(d) = function mapping flows to target stocks - F(s) = function mapping links to source stocks/variables - F(t) = function mapping links to target flows

References

Baez, J. C., Li, X., Libkind, S., Osgood, N., & Redekopp, E. (2022). Compositional Modeling with Stock and Flow Diagrams. arXiv:2205.08373
